Description: Alabaster figure of male youth (Kouros). Fragment of head, broken at neck. The hair is arranged in wavy, almost vertical lines and hangs down behind. The back hair is rendered by notched strips which form a sort of arch round top of head. The ears are free, Fine careful work. Traces of red on mouth and black on hair. Surface chipped and incrusted.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Faint pencil mark on right side of neck.
Bibliographic references: Höckmann 2007 / Zyprisch-griechische Kleinplastik: Kouroi, andere Figuren und plastisch verzierte Gefässe (n. N21)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CD.113) (Phase 3)
